body:
I'm seeing some "rq.worker:Killed horse pid XXX" in the logs, must be related to the timeouts.

I haven't changed anything in the HTTP service lately that could explain this, except https://github.com/mozilla/bugbug/commit/fafc100eecba876399f04cb6815ac5939c708f3f.

I've deployed a new version with some additional logging:
> Jul 08 08:12:36 bugbug app/api: Deployed web (f7a32d6b5b92), worker (f382ae6963ff) by user heroku-relman-deployer@mozilla.com

Let's see if the timeouts happen again, and if they do, I'll try to revert the rq upgrade.

> Jul 08 17:24:49 bugbug app/worker.3: 2020-07-08 16:24:49,439:INFO:rq.worker:default: bugbug_http.models.schedule_tests('try', '0ccaaabc4617c4d074a50dbcd326216594cefdcc') (c2208da3e41043f6aa5d2216796e4b28) 
> Jul 08 17:24:49 bugbug app/web.1: 2020-07-08 16:24:49,433:INFO:root:Request with API TOKEN 'pulse_listener' 
> Jul 08 17:24:49 bugbug app/web.1: INFO:root:Successfully requested try/0ccaaabc4617c4d074a50dbcd326216594cefdcc 
> Jul 08 17:24:51 bugbug app/worker.3: 2020-07-08 16:24:51,053:INFO:root:Processing schedule_tests:try_0ccaaabc4617c4d074a50dbcd326216594cefdcc... 
> Jul 08 17:24:51 bugbug app/worker.3: 2020-07-08 16:24:51,053:INFO:root:Loading commits to analyze using automationrelevance... 
> Jul 08 17:24:58 bugbug app/worker.3: 2020-07-08 16:24:58,416:INFO:root:Pulling commits from the remote repository... 
> Jul 08 17:32:50 bugbug app/worker.3: 2020-07-08 16:32:49,516:INFO:rq.worker:Killed horse pid 1471 

So it seems it is taking a very long time to pull from the remote repository (from both try and autoland).

issue.title: To pull, use the robustcheckout command instead of the pull command

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.title: Try to pull a few times, with a timeout of 3 minutes, before giving up

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Instead of relying on robustcheckout, which performs a full reclone after a failure.

Might help with #1673

issue.title: Pull running 'hg pull' instead of using hglib to benefit from Mercurial's default transaction rollback

repository.name: bugbug
repository.description: Platform for Machine Learning projects on Software Engineering

issue.body:
Currently we use hglib, so when we send SIGTERM to the process which is doing the pull, the process is terminated
without error handling and the repository is left in a bad state.
Instead, by using 'hg pull', we benefit from Mercurial's handling of SIGTERM: transaction rollback.

Might help with #1673

body: We have a good workaround now, so I'm going to call this fixed.
